auld hairy scottish git in Toronto. Does futile things with electronics, including trying to sell them. This ended very badly, so now I build cameras instead. I've built and operated wind farms in many places: I may know what I'm talking about here.

I've been known as scruss since 1981. Some people know me by it and may not recognize my real name.

(he/him)

formerly @scruss

Hey! If you follow me and you've got 0 posts and 0 people following you, I'm going to block you.

silver-haired gentlepunk + queer sound-bug based in Berlin.

Here: sound + music, + all serendipity and life change mastodon's magic does. here OK for minors (my other main is not, DNI)

DIY synths, upcycling, circuit bending: drone, impro, noise, collaborations, intersectional feminism, temporary autonomous zones, + other niceties.

Don't:
AI +exclusionary isms, incl. sexism + ageism.

note:
Long-time ham, CW operator, #hamradio blogger (KB6NU.Com), author of the "No Nonsense" amateur radio license study guides. I used to be:

- Communications Manager for Amateur Radio Digital Communications (ARDC),
- Freelance writer and editor,
- Website developer,
- Technical Editor for Test&Measurement World magazine,
- Electronics test engineer.

I enjoy all kinds of #hamradio activities, but my favorite thing to do is operate CW, Second would be teaching ham classes.
